title: Jimmy Dean Sausage Cheese Balls Recipe
description: These cute sausage balls are easy to make with pork sausage, baking mix, onion, and Cheddar cheese for a fun, crowd-pleasing appetizer.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Jimmy Dean Jimmy Dean Sausage Cheese Balls 4.6 (167) 136 Reviews 17 Photos These cute sausage balls are easy to make for a fun appetizer. They can be prepared ahead and frozen uncooked. Just thaw and bake when you need them! Submitted by JimmyDean Updated on September 19, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 36 Yield: 6 dozen Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 36 servings 2 (16 ounce) packages Regular Flavor Jimmy Dean Pork Sausage 4 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese 1 ½ cups all-purpose baking mix ½ cup finely chopped onion ½ cup finely chopped celery 2 teaspoons minced garlic (Optional) 2 teaspoons black pepper Directions Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Combine sausage, cheese, baking mix, onion, celery, garlic, and black pepper in a large mixing bowl; stir well until combined. Form into balls about 1-inch in diameter; place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Cool on the pan for 5 minutes before serving with cocktail forks or toothpicks. To Cook From Frozen: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C); allow frozen sausage balls to thaw on a baking sheet while the oven preheats. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 25 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Variation: For a firmer texture, add 3 cups baking mix and 2 cups shredded cheese. I Made It Print 363 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Jimmy Dean Sausage Cheese Balls 01 of 17 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 17 Photo by  DREGINEK 09/30/2023 Halved the recipe and omitted the celery - only because I didn’t have any. These were a hit with half the crowd and was “meh” for others. People dipped in ranch or Blue Cheese. Me personally- I think I would have liked better with JD Hot but - at the risk of being to hot for some others. Pretty easy and I can see being a fun, fall football appetizer. Glad we tried! Thanks Jimmy Dean! 03 of 17 Photo by  Bonnie 11/25/2021 04 of 17 Photo by  John B. 08/09/2021 05 of 17 Photo by  Martina 11/26/2020 06 of 17 Photo by  Shaun’s wifey 02/03/2019 07 of 17 Photo by  April D 11/25/2018 I add fresh minced garlic instead of store bought.. If I do use store bought, I use the kind you put in the fridge, not the dry. I am asked to bring these to every work event and I never have any left overs. UPDATE: I have started eating low car so I have recently replaced the Bisquick with a 3oz bag of plain pork rinds. Tastes awesome, I just have to hide from hubby or they won't get to work. 08 of 17 Photo by  SunnyDaysNora 11/23/2018 These are fabulous and exactly what I was looking for!! I used hot sausage but otherwise left well enough alone. These are my new go-to! 09 of 17 Photo by  Celeste Rosas 03/28/2016 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Jimmy Dean Southwestern Sausage Tarts 12 Ratings Emily's Easy Sausage and Spicy Tomato Dip 72 Ratings Chorizo Fundido 23 Ratings Best Cheese Dip 17 Ratings Big Game Dip 19 Ratings Warm Blue Cheese Dip with Garlic and Bacon 279 Ratings Jalapeno Popper Dip with Bacon 61 Ratings Baked Cowboy Dip 39 Ratings Easy Cheese Ball II 841 Ratings Chorizo Queso Dip 40 Ratings Football Cheese Ball 45 Ratings Bacon and Dill Pickle Cheese Ball 2 Ratings Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip 278 Ratings Big Game Salsa Dip 33 Ratings Baked Pepperoni Dip 15 Ratings Chef John's Hot Sloppy Joe Dip 55 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: JimmyDean
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Combine sausage, cheese, baking mix, onion, celery, garlic, and black pepper in a large mixing bowl; stir well until combined. Form into balls about 1-inch in diameter; place on an ungreased baking sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Cool on the pan for 5 minutes before serving with cocktail forks or toothpicks.
